During the last decade it has become clear that in the global economy, firms must constantly adapt to changing technological, competitive, demographic and other environmental conditions in order to survive and prosper. The importance of acquiring the knowledge and tools for changing organizations successfully cannot be overemphasized. Managing Organizational Change focuses on specific concepts, theories and tools that can guide executives entrusted with the task of leading organizational change to successful execution. Among other topics, MGMT 773 will focus on various change strategies such as leading change, managing cultural change, and mergers or acquisitions, corporate transformation, managing growth, building the customer centric organization, business process outsourcing both from client and provider perspectives, and managing radical organizational change. The perspective of the course is integrative and the focus is on successful execution.

	The majority of students enjoyed MGMT 773 due to the “engaging readings” and “stimulating class discussion.” Additionally, students commented that the reading material was “interesting.” However, a few students wished that the course was structured differently to allow for exploration of more “diverse topics.” Students reported that MGMT 773 was too focused on Information Technology and was “often a bit repetitive in terms of course concepts covered.”

	Overall, students found Professor Singh to be “passionate” and “dedicated.” One student said that his strength was to “draw out student opinions and then dig deeper to encourage people to defend them.” However, another student commented that he did not effectively “engage class interest” or “facilitate discussion.” Furthermore, students wished Professor Singh provided a better framework for “takeaways at the end of class,” which would have focused discussions more. Nevertheless, students appreciated his “enthusiasm.”

	Multiple students reported that the workload was heavy with “a lot of reading.” The prerequisites include MGMT 611 or MGMT 612.
